alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 1:54PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Randolph and northeastern Chambers Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Standing Rock, or near Stroud, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke, Stroud, Post Oak Forks, Standing Rock, Welch, Rock Mills and Stroud Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
